column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$2$2$I've taken many anti depressant drugs for the past 20 years
column3: this was just one of many. I took it about 2 years when I noticed I started falling from being dizzy and had a foggy brain. My memory was bad and I was starting to have cognitive decline where I went to a neurologist and had an MRI of my brain looking for signs of Parkinsans disease
column4: which was negative. I felt numb and not at all like myself. When I fell on a up escalator at the airport my myself
column5: my psychiatrist took me off of it and now I feel so much better
column6: more like myself and I can think clearly now. The long term effects of anti depressant meds can be dangerous but with bi polar what else could I do. I still take Zoloft and Wellbutrin.  The Lamictol worked for awhile but then it came down to not being good for me.  The benefits didn't outweigh the negative effects.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$This drug saved my life. It helped me live today and not worry about the future. I have a extreme case of bipolor. I was real parraniod . I feared people hurting me. I always worried about everything . I had racing thoughts . I am happy to say this because I am able to finally see what I had wrong and slowly change all because this medicine and the help of god. Thank you to who ever invented this medcine one day I would like to thank you in person.
